events.name: President Biden Accuses Oil Companies of War Profiteering
events.wd_label: President Biden Accuses Oil Companies of War Profiteering
events.wd_description: U.S. President Joe Biden accused oil companies of "war profiteering" and raised the possibility of a windfall tax if they do not increase domestic production to lower fuel costs.
events.description: U.S. President Joe Biden accused oil companies of "war profiteering" and raised the possibility of a windfall tax if they do not increase domestic production to lower fuel costs.

events.name: Biden's Accusation
events.wd_description: President Biden criticized oil companies for making record profits during the war while refusing to lower prices at the pump, accusing them of "war profiteering."
events.description: President Biden criticized oil companies for making record profits during the war while refusing to lower prices at the pump, accusing them of "war profiteering."

events.name: Windfall Tax Proposal
events.wd_description: Biden suggested that Congress could impose tax penalties on oil companies if they do not invest in lowering fuel costs for American citizens.
events.description: Biden suggested that Congress could impose tax penalties on oil companies if they do not invest in lowering fuel costs for American citizens.

events.name: ExxonMobil Criticism
events.wd_description: Biden specifically targeted ExxonMobil, which reported $19.7 billion in earnings in the third quarter, accusing the company of prioritizing shareholder dividends over increasing production.
events.description: Biden specifically targeted ExxonMobil, which reported $19.7 billion in earnings in the third quarter, accusing the company of prioritizing shareholder dividends over increasing production.

events.name: Ukraine Faces Russian Attacks as NATO and Poland Investigate Missile Crash
events.wd_label: Ukraine Faces Russian Attacks as NATO and Poland Investigate Missile Crash
events.wd_description: Ukraine faced renewed Russian attacks in the east as NATO and Poland concluded that a missile crash in Poland, which killed two people, was likely caused by a stray Ukrainian air defense missile.
events.description: Ukraine faced renewed Russian attacks in the east as NATO and Poland concluded that a missile crash in Poland, which killed two people, was likely caused by a stray Ukrainian air defense missile.

events.name: Russian Attacks in Eastern Ukraine
events.wd_description: Ukraine confirmed fierce attacks in the east by Russian forces, which were reinforced with troops withdrawn from Kherson, following intense strikes on civilian infrastructure.
events.description: Ukraine confirmed fierce attacks in the east by Russian forces, which were reinforced with troops withdrawn from Kherson, following intense strikes on civilian infrastructure.

events.name: Missile Crash in Poland
events.wd_description: A missile crash at a grain facility in Poland, near the Ukrainian border, killed two people, marking the first deadly extension of the war into NATO territory.
events.description: A missile crash at a grain facility in Poland, near the Ukrainian border, killed two people, marking the first deadly extension of the war into NATO territory.

events.name: NATO and Poland's Conclusion
events.wd_description: NATO and Poland concluded that the missile was likely a stray S-300 rocket fired by Ukraine's air defenses, with no evidence suggesting it was launched by Russia.
events.description: NATO and Poland concluded that the missile was likely a stray S-300 rocket fired by Ukraine's air defenses, with no evidence suggesting it was launched by Russia.

events.name: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's Visit to Kyiv
events.wd_label: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's Visit to Kyiv
events.wd_description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak visited Kyiv, pledging continued support for Ukraine and announcing a new £50 million air defense package to help counter Russian drone attacks.
events.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak visited Kyiv, pledging continued support for Ukraine and announcing a new £50 million air defense package to help counter Russian drone attacks.

events.name: Sunak's Visit to Kyiv
events.wd_description: Rishi Sunak made his first visit to Kyiv as the UK Prime Minister, reaffirming Britain's support for Ukraine and emphasizing the UK's commitment to standing with Ukraine.
events.description: Rishi Sunak made his first visit to Kyiv as the UK Prime Minister, reaffirming Britain's support for Ukraine and emphasizing the UK's commitment to standing with Ukraine.

events.name: New Air Defense Package
events.wd_description: Sunak announced a £50 million ($60 million) package, including anti-aircraft guns and radar technology, to help Ukraine defend against Russian drone attacks.
events.description: Sunak announced a £50 million ($60 million) package, including anti-aircraft guns and radar technology, to help Ukraine defend against Russian drone attacks.

events.name: Continued UK Support for Ukraine
events.wd_description: The UK pledged to increase the training provided to Ukrainian armed forces, reinforcing its ongoing support for Ukraine's defense efforts.
events.description: The UK pledged to increase the training provided to Ukrainian armed forces, reinforcing its ongoing support for Ukraine's defense efforts.

events.name: Biden Administration's $2.8 Billion Grants for EV Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_label: Biden Administration's $2.8 Billion Grants for EV Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_description: President Joe Biden announced $2.8 billion in grants to boost the electric vehicle battery supply chain, funding projects to produce battery-grade materials and reduce dependence on foreign suppliers.
events.description: President Joe Biden announced $2.8 billion in grants to boost the electric vehicle battery supply chain, funding projects to produce battery-grade materials and reduce dependence on foreign suppliers.

events.name: Grant Announcements
events.wd_description: The $2.8 billion grants come from the infrastructure law and will fund projects across multiple states to produce battery-grade materials.
events.description: The $2.8 billion grants come from the infrastructure law and will fund projects across multiple states to produce battery-grade materials.

events.name: Projects and Investments
events.wd_description: Funded projects include efforts to make enough lithium and graphite to supply millions of EVs annually, and create an electrode binder facility to meet future demand.
events.description: Funded projects include efforts to make enough lithium and graphite to supply millions of EVs annually, and create an electrode binder facility to meet future demand.

events.name: American Battery Technology Project
events.wd_description: Developing a new process to extract and refine lithium from a sedimentary deposit in Nevada through the American Battery Technology Company.
events.description: Developing a new process to extract and refine lithium from a sedimentary deposit in Nevada through the American Battery Technology Company.

events.name: Cirba Solutions Project
events.wd_description: Expanding and upgrading Cirba Solutions’ existing lithium-ion recycling facility in Lancaster, Ohio to produce more lithium.
events.description: Expanding and upgrading Cirba Solutions’ existing lithium-ion recycling facility in Lancaster, Ohio to produce more lithium.

events.name: Ascend Elements Project
events.wd_description: Constructing a cathode active materials (CAM) plant at a greenfield site in Hopkinsville, Kentucky.
events.description: Constructing a cathode active materials (CAM) plant at a greenfield site in Hopkinsville, Kentucky.

events.name: Albemarle Project
events.wd_description: Constructing a new, commercial-scale U.S.-based lithium materials processing plant at Kings Mountain, North Carolina.
events.description: Constructing a new, commercial-scale U.S.-based lithium materials processing plant at Kings Mountain, North Carolina.

events.name: Anovion Project
events.wd_description: Expanding Anovion's Sanborn, New York manufacturing into Alabama with a new graphite manufacturing facility.
events.description: Expanding Anovion's Sanborn, New York manufacturing into Alabama with a new graphite manufacturing facility.

events.name: American Battery Materials Initiative
events.wd_description: The initiative aims to strengthen battery material and mineral supply chains through coordination with tribal nations and international partners.
events.description: The initiative aims to strengthen battery material and mineral supply chains through coordination with tribal nations and international partners.
